title: The Thirteen Innocents
description: Inspector Duval traces an upturn in drug trafficking in Vienna, but the source is an unlikely one- homing pigeons from Istanbul.

title: The Money Game
description: A complex plan is unleashed that sees a leading financial journalist report that one of Europe's most influential financiers has died. As the markets react to the news, Interpol must discover who had most to gain from such reporting.

title: The Sleeping Giant
description: A massive unexploded bomb is found in Scotland. Interpol race against time to find anyone who may know something about the construction of the bomb so an attempt can be made to disarm it.

title: The Two-Headed Monster
description: A gangster is deported to Naples after a stretch in a U.S. prison, but when he arrives, he sets up a new gang with a protection racket.

title: The Long Weekend
description: Before Duval can start his holiday, a bizarre case arises where the body of a man lost at sea in the Mediterranian washes up in Dover shortly afterward, shot to death.

title: You Can't Die Twice
description: Interpol are called in when a man is killed in a car accident. At first they think an international thief has been killed, till they discover the same man died in a gun fight in a completely different country 3 months before.

title: Private View
description: Interpol are called in when a series of jewelry thefts seem to be linked to the movements of European royalty. The investigating officers must discover how the criminals are getting the information.

title: Dead on Arrival
description: A diplomatic courier is killed on a seemingly routine mission. Inspector Duval decides to recreate the man's final journey in an attempt to unravel the mystery.

title: Air Switch
description: Interpol become aware of medical drugs being stolen from inbound aircraft and replaced with water. The investigation centers as much on how the thefts are being staged as to who is responsible.

title: The Chinese Mask
description: Interpol become involved after the theft of a huge amount of platinum. As they begin to investigate they discover a string of crimes dating back years that all appear to have been committed by the same person.

title: Slave Ship
description: An abandoned vessel is found with a number of people dead from a typhoid out break. The suspicion is the vessel was being used in the slave trade. Interpol begin the long process of gathering evidence.

title: The Man's a Clown
description: Interpol become aware of a counterfeit operation producing American money. The struggle to understand how the money could be spread across so many countries so quickly. As Duval gets closer to the truth a life and death situation develops.

title: Last Man Lucky
description: A mysterious note found on a murdered man leads Interpol men to uncover a new "Murder Incorporated"-style organization operating in London and Paris.

title: No Flowers for Onno
description: Interpol are investigating currency fraud in the Netherlands. What starts as an open and shut case, quickly takes unexpected twists when it is realized one of the chief suspects has been dead for 15 years

title: Mr. George
description: A man extorts a large sum of money from an insurance company. Interpol begin a tireless operation to track the man through countries that don't have Interpol agreements.

title: The Thousand Mile Alibi
description: A woman is found dead, and Interpol begin the search for suspects. Their greatest problem is the man with most to gain, is currently in another country driving an endurance car race.

title: Act of Piracy
description: A cargo ship is stopped and seemingly robbed by a US Navy ship. Interpol are called to try and solve the case and figure out who had the expertise to handle such a ship.

title: Game for Three Hands
description: Inspector Duval meets a man who he believes strangled his wife many years before. The only problem for Duval in this open and shut case is the suspect only has one arm.

title: The Collector
description: Duval tries to track down who is responsible for a series of seemingly unrelated murders. Duval thinks there is a lot more involved and peruses the investigation with his usual passion.

title: Fingers of Guilt
description: Duval struggles to crack a case where the main suspect based on finger prints, turns up to be still sitting in jail from a previous conviction.

title: The Girl with Grey Hair
description: A woman has slashed a painting being auctioned, claiming the supposedly dead artist was her lover, and faked his death to increase the value of his works.

title: Trial at Cranby's Creek
description: Duval arrives in a small mining town in Western Australia to arrest a man for murder in Belgium. He faces opposition from the local police who also want the man for a local crime. Duval is concerned over the way the judicial process is playing out

title: Ascent to Murder
description: Duval travels to Northern India to interview a man about a case he is investigating. He discovers the man's room is booby trapped and needs to try and work out who had the best motive for trying to kill the man.

title: Slow Boat to Amsterdam
description: Duval is held up in a small canal town when a strange death occurs. The local authorities think the death is a straight forward suicide, but Duval sees evidence of something more sinister.

title: White Blackmail
description: Duval travels to Switzerland on the trail of a blackmailer when he encounters a young lady being aggressively perused by a confidence man. But everything may not be as it seems.

title: A Foreign Body
description: A body is found in the back of a car in London. Duval becomes intrigued when a suspect is so easily found. As he begins to investigate his doubt grows and the situation becomes more complex

title: In the Swim
description: Interpol are called in after a cross channel swimmer is killed moments after he completes his swim. Duval must puzzle out the man's last words and try to understand why he was killed.

title: The Three Keys
description: Interpol discover a number of bank vaults that rather than be robbed have had all their money switched for counterfeit notes. Duval and his team have to work out how the crime was committed and who is responsible.

title: Eight Days Inclusive
description: A series of jewelery store hold ups are being committed by a man and woman that seemingly disappear after each job. The pair are actually the driver and guide of a tour bus, making the most of their scheduled stops.

title: Dressed to Kill
description: Interpol is asked to do background checks on employees at a fashion house. As an added precaution the also plant an undercover operator. Quickly Duval discovers his concerns are well found.

title: Cargo of Death
description: A load of contaminated cholera vaccine is stolen and released into the black market. Duval embarks on a desperate search in North India before a full blown epidemic kills millions.

title: Desert Hi-Jack
description: Duval goes to North Africa to investigate a series of arms shipments that have been stolen from the Foreign Legion. He does not realize how close he is to solving the case, until the gun runners decide to act.

title: Pipeline
description: Duval travels to South America to organize the extradition of a wanted criminal. Unfortunately Duval arrives in a country that is in the middle of a civil war.

title: The Absent Assassin
description: Duval is called in after an assassination of an American diplomat. Evidence seems to point to a recently released Nazi seeking revenge. What does puzzle Duval is how he constructs the assassinations.
